byline.contributor: Dharisha Bastians contributed reporting from Colombo, Sri Lanka.

abstract: News Analysis; government of Sri Lankan Pres Maithripala Sirisena is pushing United Nations to delay inquiry into war crimes committed against ethnic Tamils and to give country time to devise its own system for prosecuting perpetrators; Western countries must decide whether administration's promises of reconciliation justify putting off long-sought investigation.
lead_paragraph: The country hopes that its promise to look into war crimes will forestall the release of a United Nations inquiry that is set to be released in March.

headline.main: Sri Lanka’s New Government Hopes to Revisit Past on Its Own Terms
headline.print_headline: Sri Lanka’s New Government Hopes to Revisit Past on Its Own Terms

snippet: The country hopes that its promise to look into war crimes will forestall the release of a United Nations inquiry that is set to be released in March.
